name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
Altogether, this package includes 49 bills to help communities like ours combat drought and wildfires.

We've all seen the shocking photos at Lake Mead. Nevada's water crisis is right now and that's why I'm leading the fight for Congress to act.
https://t.co/N03FEQtI00

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: And the fifth of my bills, H.R. 5345, is a bipartisan bill that would provide the U.S. Geological Survey the resources it needs to conserve and preserve essential Saline Lake habitats across the West.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
These two bills empower the public with open access to critical water data measurements that inform smarter water decisions everywhere.

From farmers to scientists to water management, better data means a better future for Nevada's water supplies.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
H.R. 7792, The Water Data Act and H.R. 4832, The‚ÄØOpenET Data Act‚ÄØwill tackle another component of our drought: data.

The fact is, you can't manage what you can't measure. Lake Mead's water levels are going down fast, and we need to understand where Nevada is losing water.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
That means more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans.

But we also have to protect the water flowing into Lake Mead. The Las Vegas Wash carries 200 million gallons of water to Lake Mead daily. H.R. 8415 provides necessary funds to support SNWA's efforts to protect it.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
Nevada and California are partnering on one of these projects, and the result will be more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans. 

@SNWA_H2O expects to receive around 25% of the water produced in the form of an exchange of water supply from the Colorado River.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
Let's start with H.R. 8434: The Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act.

This legislation builds on my work in the #Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act to expand funding for large-scale water recycling projects.

But how does this impact Lake Mead?

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
ICYMI: The House recently passed monumental legislation to tackle the west's worst drought in 12 centuries.

This package includes 5 of my bills that will help keep more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text:
155 years ago, word finally spread to Texas that slavery as they knew it had ended.

While today is a celebration, it‚Äôs a reminder we have a ways to go to achieve true justice for Black Americans.

I‚Äôm proud to sign onto legislation to recognize #Juneteenth as a national holiday.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: This bill is an important step towards creating a system built on fairness and justice for Black Americans, and all Americans. I look forward to working with my colleagues in the Senate to reach a bipartisan deal.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: Let me be clear: The Justice in Policing Act does not defund the police, but rather holds law enforcement accountable while improving community services and programs that have been neglected for decades.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: Most importantly, the Justice in Policing Act will help communities reimagine public safety by investing in mental health & homeless services, rehabilitation, & vital programs, while helping local police focus on work we really need them for, which is keeping our streets safe.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: This Justice in Policing Act would create a system of accountability and transparency in law enforcement and eliminate harmful practices like chokeholds and no-knock warrants.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: While our local law enforcement agencies have taken important steps to build community trust and reform their use of force guidelines, there is definitely a need to do more to ensure transparency and accountability in policing from the federal level.

name: Rep. Susie Lee
tweet_text: In recent weeks, I‚Äôve spoken with leaders in the Black community, activists, and law enforcement about the right ways to fix our criminal justice system and improve policing:
